messages.content: You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Ceiling Fan
  ***Properties***
    Speed
      Enum
        Off [0]
        Low [33]
        Medium [66]
        High [100]
    Direction
      Enum
        Forward [0]
        Reverse [1]
    Light Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Speed [SSPD]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Off
          Low
          Medium
          High
    Set Direction [SDIR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Forward
          Reverse
    Light On [LON]
    Light Off [LOF]
    Query Status [QST]
USER QUERY:
Can you set the ceiling fan to medium speed and make it spin in reverse direction?

First, I review the device properties and commands. The fan speed property supports Off, Low, Medium, and High, and the direction can be Forward or Reverse. The accepted commands to change these are Set Speed (SSPD) with an enum parameter and Set Direction (SDIR) with an enum parameter.

To set the fan to medium speed, I use the Set Speed command with parameter 'Medium'. To make it spin in reverse, I use the Set Direction command with parameter 'Reverse'.

Result: Send SSPD with 'Medium' and SDIR with 'Reverse' to set the fan speed to medium and direction to reverse.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Water Heater
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Energy Usage
      Range 0.0 to 50.0 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 30 to 75 Unit °C
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
    Query Energy Usage [QEU]
USER QUERY:
I want to set the water heater temperature to 60 degrees Celsius and turn it on. How do I do that?

I first check the device properties and commands. The temperature can be set between 30 and 75 °C using the Set Temperature command (STEMP) with a parameter in that range. The power status can be turned on or off using Power On (PON) and Power Off (POF) commands.

To meet the user's request, I will send STEMP with parameter 60 to set the temperature to 60 °C, and then send PON to turn the heater on.

Result: Execute STEMP(60) to set temperature and PON to power on the water heater.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Window Blind
  ***Properties***
    Position
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [100]
    Battery Level
      Range 0 to 100 Unit %
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Position [SPOS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 100 Unit %
    Open [OPEN]
    Close [CLOSE]
    Query Battery [QBAT]
USER QUERY:
Could you open the window blind halfway and tell me the battery level?

Reviewing the device structure, the window blind's position can be set from 0 to 100 percent using the Set Position command (SPOS). The battery level is a property ranging from 0 to 100 percent, and can be queried with Query Battery (QBAT).

To open the blind halfway, I will send SPOS with parameter 50. To get the battery level, I will send QBAT.

Result: Send SPOS(50) to open the blind halfway and QBAT to retrieve the battery level.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Air Purifier
  ***Properties***
    Fan Speed
      Enum
        Low [1]
        Medium [2]
        High [3]
    Filter Status
      Enum
        Good [0]
        Replace Soon [1]
        Replace Now [2]
    Air Quality Index
      Range 0 to 500 Unit AQI
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Fan Speed [SFAN]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Low
          Medium
          High
    Reset Filter [RFILT]
    Query Air Quality [QAIR]
USER QUERY:
Please set the air purifier to high fan speed and check the air quality index.

The device supports fan speeds Low, Medium, and High, set via the Set Fan Speed command (SFAN) with an enum parameter. The air quality index (AQI) ranges from 0 to 500 and can be queried with Query Air Quality (QAIR).

To fulfill the request, I will send SFAN with parameter 'High' to set the fan speed to high, and then send QAIR to get the current air quality index.

Result: Execute SFAN('High') to set fan speed and QAIR to check air quality index.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Refrigerator
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range -5 to 10 Unit °C
    Door Status
      Enum
        Closed [0]
        Open [1]
    Power Consumption
      Range 0.0 to 5.0 Unit kWh
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range -5 to 10 Unit °C
    Lock Door [LOCK]
    Unlock Door [UNLOCK]
    Query Power Usage [QPU]
USER QUERY:
Can you lower the refrigerator temperature to 2 degrees Celsius and lock the door?

The refrigerator temperature can be set between -5 and 10 °C using the Set Temperature command (STEMP). The door can be locked or unlocked using Lock Door (LOCK) and Unlock Door (UNLOCK) commands.

To lower the temperature to 2 °C, I will send STEMP with parameter 2. To lock the door, I will send LOCK.

Result: Send STEMP(2) to set temperature and LOCK to secure the door.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Sprinkler System
  ***Properties***
    Zone Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Water Flow Rate
      Range 0 to 20 Unit L/min
    Schedule Enabled
      Enum
        False [0]
        True [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Zone [START]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Zone1
          Zone2
          Zone3
    Stop Zone [STOP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Zone1
          Zone2
          Zone3
    Set Flow Rate [SFR]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 20 Unit L/min
    Enable Schedule [ENSC]
    Disable Schedule [DISSC]
USER QUERY:
I want to start watering Zone2 with a flow rate of 15 liters per minute and enable the schedule. How can I do that?

The device accepts commands to start and stop zones with parameters Zone1, Zone2, or Zone3. The flow rate can be set between 0 and 20 L/min using Set Flow Rate (SFR). Schedule can be enabled or disabled with Enable Schedule (ENSC) and Disable Schedule (DISSC).

To start watering Zone2, send Start Zone with parameter 'Zone2'. To set flow rate to 15 L/min, send SFR with parameter 15. To enable the schedule, send ENSC.

Result: Execute START('Zone2'), SFR(15), and ENSC to start watering Zone2 at 15 L/min and enable the schedule.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Security Camera
  ***Properties***
    Recording Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
    Night Vision
      Enum
        Disabled [0]
        Enabled [1]
    Storage Used
      Range 0 to 256 Unit GB
  ***Accept Commands***
    Start Recording [REC_START]
    Stop Recording [REC_STOP]
    Enable Night Vision [NV_ON]
    Disable Night Vision [NV_OFF]
    Query Storage [QSTOR]
USER QUERY:
Turn on recording and enable night vision on the security camera.

The camera's recording status can be controlled with Start Recording (REC_START) and Stop Recording (REC_STOP). Night vision can be enabled or disabled with NV_ON and NV_OFF commands.

To turn on recording, send REC_START. To enable night vision, send NV_ON.

Result: Execute REC_START to start recording and NV_ON to enable night vision.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Oven
  ***Properties***
    Temperature
      Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Timer
      Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Oven Status
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Temperature [STEMP]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 50 to 300 Unit °C
    Set Timer [STIME]
      Parameter 1: []
        Range 0 to 180 Unit minutes
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
USER QUERY:
Please preheat the oven to 200 degrees Celsius and set a timer for 45 minutes.

The oven temperature can be set between 50 and 300 °C using Set Temperature (STEMP). The timer can be set from 0 to 180 minutes using Set Timer (STIME). The oven can be powered on or off with PON and POF.

To preheat, first power on the oven with PON, then set temperature to 200 °C with STEMP(200), and set the timer to 45 minutes with STIME(45).

Result: Send PON to power on, STEMP(200) to set temperature, and STIME(45) to set timer.
You are a smart home assistant and NuCore expert.

DEVICE STRUCTURE:
***Device***
Name: Smart Coffee Maker
  ***Properties***
    Brew Strength
      Enum
        Mild [0]
        Regular [1]
        Strong [2]
    Water Level
      Range 0 to 2000 Unit ml
    Power
      Enum
        Off [0]
        On [1]
  ***Accept Commands***
    Set Brew Strength [SBS]
      Parameter 1: []
        Enum
          Mild
          Regular
          Strong
    Start Brew [START]
    Stop Brew [STOP]
    Power On [PON]
    Power Off [POF]
USER QUERY:
Can you make the coffee maker brew strong coffee and start brewing?

The coffee maker supports brew strengths Mild, Regular, and Strong, set via Set Brew Strength (SBS). Brewing can be started or stopped with Start Brew (START) and Stop Brew (STOP). Power can be turned on or off with PON and POF.

To brew strong coffee, first ensure the device is powered on by sending PON, then set brew strength to Strong with SBS('Strong'), and finally start brewing with START.

Result: Send PON, SBS('Strong'), and START to brew strong coffee.
